intro: Gnaphalodes dentata, commonly known as the toothed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, toothed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Gnaphalodes dentata is often found in disturbed areas and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with well-drained soil.
